Bad, bad luck.
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2012 Topics: Bad, bad luck.
By Ricky777 on Wednesday, May 23, 2012 - 02:41 pm:

I restarted playing through MR2. I started off just raising a Gaboo named Joe for fun,I didn't use any method off the Internet, and I got him up to B rank in 2 years. The FIRST, TIME, I sent him to Kawrea, guess who I ran into? Can you guess? IT. WAS. PUNISHER! You know, the tougher of the two A rank monsters there? An attack of 666? I didn't save immediately beforehand, never used drugs, and he died early at 3 years 6 months.

By Ricky777 on Wednesday, May 23, 2012 - 03:34 pm:

The next monster I really trained was a Horn(Suezo/Tiger) named Bruise. This was the only monster I ever raised and truely felt a bond with, as I have played Pokemon for far too long. This is when I discovered that monsters can change their favorite thing, as Bruise asked me to play with him repeatedly for 3 months before he died on an expedition to get a Golden Peach for him, and I forgot to save beforehand, and the week before the expedition I felt like such a jerk, because the last time I checked his status, his favorite thing was "Ricky".

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, May 23, 2012 - 08:19 pm:

Aw....

By Ricky777 on Thursday, May 24, 2012 - 07:22 am:

I know! It's like MR is the mirror of Pokemon: it makes you grow more attached to them.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, May 24, 2012 - 09:35 am:

At least now you know to save your monsters. It's kind of fun to revisit them once in a while.

By Ricky777 on Thursday, May 24, 2012 - 10:42 am:

Yeah. I guess. By the way, Lisa(I can just call you Lisa, right?), my dad is going through all of our old CD's, and I'll try toget the information for each one posted. He's been keeping a journal!

By fiffa46 on Thursday, May 24, 2012 - 02:24 pm:

Aww that's terrible. But as with all games save often and have more then one file for each play. Save save save.

By Ricky777 on Thursday, May 24, 2012 - 03:00 pm:

I usually do that! But what's really interesting is that I made Bruise through combination of two hoppers; one, the main breed, Hopper/Tiger; two, the secondary breed, Hopper/Suezo; and I got Bruise through the main breed being the secondary breed's sub-breed, and the sub-breed being the main breed's sub-breed. Basically, I had a 2-3% chance of getting him. No resets needed to make the combination that result.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, May 24, 2012 - 07:56 pm:
